review_title: Upper Management Do Not Care About You
pros:
- Lecturing team and subject-specific teams are great.

- Facilities are above average for the teaching suites.

- Good community due to the size of courses.
cons:
- Upper management does not care about you and rule with an iron fist with policies that are based on stats and money as opposed to logic and consideration for the staff below them.

- Upper management is currently 'enforcing' a 3-day on-campus delivery rule during COVID, with no care about staff health or risk of health from traveling in via public transport. The fact here is that no student sessions are taking place on campus, which means course lecturers that deliver 100% of their sessions online are being 'forced' into campus 3 days a week to effectively deliver 'THE SAME' online content but from the campus. There has been absolutely no logic or thought has been put into this policy regarding staff physical and mental health, only the risk of losing money and stats matters.

- University states it is 'connected' but uses multiple systems and platforms that we have to use to do our day to day job.

pros: Friendly colleagues, practical courses, improving facilities.
cons: Location in Stoke-on-Trent is interesting with a great industrial history, but even though the campus is fine, the surrounding areas are a little shabby. If the University succeeds in its mission this will help the area to grow and improve. (not really any cons)

review_title: Struggle to find anything bad to say!
pros: The main campus is a 5 minute walk from the railway station, and University buildings start opening at about 6am - so you can be on site laptop fired up AND a fresh coffee in your hand by 0605 missing all of the traffic. Both libraries are well stocked & are comfortable places to work. You are never far from a cafe or bar, whichever is your preference, and both sites in Stoke are extremely pleasant places to be.
cons: Parking! Is a NIGHTMARE .. it has changed in the past year or so, but in the end I stopped using my car and went on the train which of course takes away some independence, and restricts what time you can arrive on site, and leave too. Using the train however does have some significant advantages, but only if you avoid the commuter trains.

review_title: Where do Students sit on the priority list?
pros: Some great and talented individuals on the teaching team, passionate students largely from around the local area who are in deprived areas from a UK standard.
cons:
Many terrible leaders and senior management team members, incompetent colleagues and a higher institution that seems to care more about numbers and league tables over the quality of students learning and experience.

Feels as if you have to kiss up to get anywhere at this institution, being buddy buddy with the senior staff seems to get you far. People are more than happy to step on your toes to get where they want.

Decisions being made without consulting teaching staff, most often terrible decisions that teaching staff then have to find ways to make it work and minimise poor student backlash.

I truly do not feel valued working here.

job_title: Student Communications Ambassador in Stoke-on-Trent, England
pros: As a student myself at the time, working for the university really helped my financial situation, especially with such a good hourly rate. The team I worked with were exceptionally supportive and understanding, with my workload reflecting my balance of job and course work, as the academic years progressed. I was able to have a lot of input on the direction of  the content I produced in this role, and felt any concerns I had were listened too and taken onboard.
cons: Lots of department changes over the few years I worked there meant it was difficult to remember the chain of command, had I needed any extra guidance or needed to report to different individuals for different projects

pros: Large amounts of training offered. Good work life balance.
cons: I have been mis-payed 3 months running now, My tax code has been altered numerous times due to a P45 not being processed, and when trying to sort these issues I have simply been bounced from HR, to Payroll and back again with everyone I speak to telling me someone else is who should handle it.

review_title: Fantastic university and flexible job opportunities
pros: Very flexible. Worked as a Student Ambassador and I could basically choose which jobs I wanted to work. Staff and management were super helpful and friendly and the pay was excellent!
cons: Many jobs are 'first come first served'. My first year was hard as many jobs wanted students who had 'experience' within that job..

pros: I have worked at the Stafford Campus. Students are well behaved, open doors for each other. No litter about. Staff are extremely professional and always there for their students. Clean environment. Catering staff are always cheerful.
cons: Moving to Stoke campus !
